intro: Doona disticha, commonly known as the common doona, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late summer to early autumn. Doona disticha is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
